title: Video Concrete bunkers installed for protection amid Ukraine‚Äôs offensive inside Russia - ABC News
text: Concrete bunkers installed for protection amid Ukraine‚Äôs offensive inside Russia A massive fire in Russia after an attack on a ferry by Ukraine resulted in multiple explosions and the sinking of the ferry. Russian officials are installing concrete bunkers for protection. author: Not√≠cias do Rio
title: Governo cancela expediente em √≥rg√£os federais no Rio nesta sexta
text:
Alerta m√°ximo: Saiba como se proteger em caso de chuva forte, alagamento e risco de deslizamento Chuva no Rio: 'Eu vou ter cora√ß√£o como se as crian√ßas come√ßam a perguntar se n√≥s vamos morrer?', questiona moradora da Baixada A previs√£o √© de chuvas fortes at√© domingo. O prefeito Eduardo Paes afirmou que sexta-feira deve ser o pior dia, a come√ßar pela madrugada, que tem previs√£o de temporal. Paes pediu que a popula√ß√£o fique de olho nos canais de comunica√ß√£o da prefeitura e na imprensa.
Saiba o que funciona ou n√£o
servidores federais dever√£o, quando cab√≠vel, desempenhar suas atividades de forma integralmente remota, "ressalvado o caso daqueles que exercem atividades consideradas servi√ßo essencial, os quais devem ser preservados, na forma definida pelos dirigentes m√°ximos de cada √≥rg√£o ou entidade" escolas municipais do Rio suspenderam as atividades servi√ßos essenciais , como sa√∫de, permanecem funcionando. Segundo a Secretaria municipal de Sa√∫de do Rio, todas as unidades funcionam nesta sexta Tribunal de Justi√ßa do Rio suspendeu o expediente UFRJ tem atividades presenciais suspensas em todos os campi; aula magna com o ministro Celso Amorim foi cancelada UNIRio suspendeu todas as atividades presenciai letivas e administrativas Uerj determinou ponto facultativo UFRRJ tem "aulas assincronas" ‚Äî como videoaulas ‚Äî e atividades administrativas realizadas remotamente Universidade Est√°cio suspendeu as aulas Detran.RJ n√£o abre nesta sexta-feira. Quem tinha agendamento para hoje, pode voltar em cinco dias √∫teis sem agendar bancos funcionam normalmente creches particulares n√£o entraram em consenso. Algumas discutem se fecham ou n√£o. O melhor a fazer √© entrar em contato com a unidade escolas particulares tamb√©m n√£o entraram em consenso: algumas mantiveram as aulas e outras ainda discutem se as suspendem. Outras mant√©m as atividades at√© meio-dia vacina√ß√£o est√° mantida INSS mant√©m os atendimentos Rio Farmes abre at√© o meio-dia Rio Imagem e ambulat√≥rio m√©dico especializado suspenderam o atendimento unidades de sa√∫de estaduais funcionam Consulado dos Estados Unidos mant√©m o funcionamento eventos cancelados por causa da chuva: Babil√¥nia Feira Hype (s√°bado e domingo); Junta Local (s√°bado em Laranjeiras e domingo na Tijuca); Carioqu√≠ssima (s√°bado e domingo); Rock 80 Festival (s√°bado e domingo); Samba Luzia (sexta-feira); Festa da Ra√ßa (sexta-feira) Rodovi√°ria Novo Rio est√° com a opera√ß√£o mantida
Mais recente Pr√≥xima Grave acidente envolvendo caminh√£o, carros, moto e um √¥nibus em Niter√≥i; sete ficaram feridos

author: VNExplorer
title: Iv√°n Duque hab√≠a advertido que Maduro buscar√≠a repetir elecciones para ganar tiempo, calmar protestas y presi√≥n internacional
text: Iv√°n Duque y Nicol√°s Maduro. Una semana despu√©s de las elecciones presidenciales en Venezuela celebradas el 28 de julio pasado, el expresidente Iv√°n Duque fue uno de los primeros dirigentes pol√≠ticos en advertir el Plan B de Nicol√°s Maduro tras su derrota en las urnas frente a Edmundo Gonz√°lez y Mar√≠a Corina Machado: adelantar nuevas elecciones. Textualmente, el 4 de agosto pasado, Duque, quien ha estado activo frente al conflicto interno de ese pa√≠s, anticip√≥: ‚ÄúEl presidente de Colombia, Gustavo Petro, sugerir√≠a repetir las elecciones para ayudar a Nicol√°s Maduro, y se estar√≠a buscando que M√©xico y Brasil hagan lo propio‚Äù. Y ocurri√≥. Este jueves, 15 de agosto, Gustavo Petro despej√≥ en redes sociales las dudas sobre su postura para salir de la crisis en Venezuela. ‚ÄúLevantamiento de todas las sanciones contra ese pa√≠s, amnist√≠a general nacional e internacional, garant√≠as totales a la acci√≥n pol√≠tica, gobierno de cohabitaci√≥n transitorio y nuevas elecciones libres‚Äù. Agreg√≥ que de Nicol√°s Maduro depende una soluci√≥n pol√≠tica para Venezuela que lleve paz y la prosperidad a su pueblo. Tal como lo advirti√≥ Iv√°n Duque, el presidente de Brasil, Luiz In√°cio Lula Da Silva, coment√≥ la posibilidad de que se repitan las elecciones presidenciales para resolver el manto de duda que qued√≥ sobre la contienda del domingo 28 de julio. La directora de SEMANA, Vicky D√°vila, habl√≥ en exclusiva con la l√≠der opositora Mar√≠a Corina Machado quien rechaz√≥ la propuesta de repetir las elecciones. ‚ÄúHemos planteado una negociaci√≥n para la transici√≥n democr√°tica. He escuchado planteamientos de nuevas elecciones, eso es un exabrupto; la elecci√≥n aqu√≠ ya ocurri√≥, ocurri√≥ con las reglas del juego del r√©gimen, ocurri√≥ en condiciones totalmente asim√©tricas, y aun as√≠, no solamente ganamos, arrasamos y lo demostramos‚Äù, dijo Machado.

author: anon-1irn
title: Re: 'Youngkin 1, Biden 0': WH Backpedals on Blocking Knights of Columbus Mem. Day Mass at Nat'l Cemetery
text: The National Parks Service under the Biden administration had denied a Virginia chapter of the Knights of Columbus a permit to hold a Memorial Day service at the Poplar Grove National Cemetery. Virginia Attorney General Jason Miyares then took action on behalf of the Knights of Columbus, with the blessing of Gov. Glenn Youngkin: I just filed an amicus brief supporting the Petersburg Knights of Columbus‚Äô right to continue its Memorial Day Mass prayer gathering tradition at Poplar Grove National Cemetery.‚Äî Jason Miyares (@JasonMiyaresVA) The Biden Administration‚Äôs actions against this Catholic group violate the First Amendment. [pic.twitter.com/nPEAFpzmho] [May 23, 2024] Virginia is the birthplace of religious liberty and I applaud our AG‚Äî Governor Glenn Youngkin (@GovernorVA) [@JasonMiyaresVA]standing side by side with the [@KofC]to protect this important and worthy tradition. [https://t.co/dxpKKvNGvp] [May 23, 2024] Maybe the Biden administration decided this was a bad look even for them, especially on Memorial Day weekend, because a backpedal has taken place: Within hours of my filing, the Biden Administration reversed course and will now allow the Knights of Columbus to gather at the Poplar Grove National Cemetery this Memorial Day.‚Äî Jason Miyares (@JasonMiyaresVA) It‚Äôs shameful that they were denied in the first place. [https://t.co/QX9vVyFQ2q] [May 23, 2024] Biden administration retreats, allows Knights of Columbus council to hold Memorial Day Mass at Poplar Grove National Cemetery -‚Äî Valerie Richardson (@ValRichardson17) [https://t.co/KeCF8fnXTY]- [@washtimes] [@twthigherground] [#Petersburg] [#Catholic] [#1A] [May 23, 2024] Recommended From the [Washington Times](https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2024/may/23/knights-columbus-hold-memorial-day-mass-petersburg/?utm_campaign=shareaholic&utm_medium=twitter&utm_source=socialnetwork): A local Knights of Columbus council will once again be able to hold its Memorial Day Mass at Poplar Grove National Cemetery in Petersburg, Virginia, after an about-face by the National Park Service. The First Liberty Institute said Thursday that the Petersburg National Battlefield has granted a permit for the Knights of Columbus Council 694 to hold its annual service, a tradition that dates back at least 60 years, after previously rejecting the group‚Äôs request. ‚ÄúWe are grateful to the NPS for allowing the Knights to hold their service this Memorial Day,‚Äù said John Moran, partner at McGuireWoods LLP in Washington, D.C., who represented the local council. So, if you're keeping score at home... Gov. Youngkin: 1.‚Äî Steve Guest (@SteveGuest) Joe Biden: 0. [https://t.co/iNSVk2VYUx] [May 24, 2024] Another L for Biden. An epic retreat by Biden admin after just one‚Äî Matthew Moran (@mmoran0226) [@JasonMiyaresVA]‚Äôs court filing and one [@GlennYoungkin]tweet üòÇ [https://t.co/kkhuxdH630] [May 24, 2024] It's a shame this had to happen in the first place. If a "social justice" group wanted to protest there the Park Service under Biden probably would have done nothing about it.

author: Kristi Turnquist | kturnquist@oregonian.com
title: Locally made, Sherlock Holmes-inspired puppet TV series pilot now viewable online
text:
Updated: Dec. 26, 2024, 1:53 p.m. | Published: Dec. 26, 2024, 1:51 p.m.
The pilot for "Fogtown," a locally made project featuring puppets as characters inspired by Sherlock Holmes stories, is now available to watch online. Courtesy Hapstance Films
By Kristi Turnquist | The Oregonian/OregonLive Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson, the crime-solving characters created by author Arthur Conan Doyle, have inspired all sorts of interpretations, from movies to TV series. But the Portland-made ‚ÄúFogtown‚Äù adds its own twist to the duo, presenting them as puppets.
Created and directed by Austin Hillebrecht and Sean Parker, ‚ÄúFogtown‚Äù was conceived to be a potential TV series. The filmmakers have completed a pilot episode, ‚ÄúMystery of the Moth Napper,‚Äù which had a Portland theatrical premiere in August, at PAM CUT‚Äôs Tomorrow Theater, the Southeast Portland venue operated by the Portland Art Museum‚Äôs Center for an Untold Tomorrow.
The journey to get ‚ÄúFogtown‚Äù to reach more viewers -- and to generate support for the project -- is continuing, as the pilot episode is now available to watch online.
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->arts and entertainment

author: @YokotaAirBase
title: Fussa native receives AF Security Forces of the Year award > Yokota Air Base > Article Display
text: Fussa native receives AF Security Forces of the Year award Published May 2, 2024 By Airman 1st Class Dave S. Calcote 374th Airlift Wing Public Affairs YOKOTA AIR BASE, Japan -- Fussa native Tatsuya Hara, 374th Security Forces Squadron chief of civilian defense, was named the Air Force Outstanding Security Forces Flight-level Civilian Supervisor of the Year due to his efforts at Yokota Air Base.This Air Force-level award is bestowed upon individuals who have made outstanding contributions to the defense and security mission of the U.S. Air Force and its allies. It recognizes civilian employees who have demonstrated exceptional leadership, dedication, innovation and performance in supporting the Air Force's mission.Growing up in Fussa and in close proximity to Yokota Air Base, the military presence in Fussa sparked Hara‚Äôs interest in getting involved with the base.‚ÄúThe base held friendship festivals every year and I went every time,‚Äù said Hara. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been my dream to work here since I was a kid.‚Äù Tatsuya Hara, 374th Security Forces Squadron chief of civilian defense, opens a patrol car door at Yokota Air Base, Japan, April 30, 2024. Hara was nominated for the Air Force Outstanding Security Forces Flight-level Civilian Supervisor of the Year and later won at the Air Force level due to his contributions to the defense and security mission of the U.S. Air Force. (U.S. Air Force photo by Airman 1st Class Dave S. Calcote) Photo Details / Download Hi-Res In 1990, Hara‚Äôs dream had come true when he started working on the base as a civilian guard for the security forces squadron. The 374th SFS is responsible for maintaining a safe and secure environment for personnel, resources, and operations at Yokota Air Base. Hara has since worked for the unit for over 30 years and now supervises over 80 Japanese civilian guards.‚ÄúHara-san‚Äôs the expert at security for the friendship festival event,‚Äù said Chief Master Sgt. Brandy Collins, 374th Security Forces Squadron senior enlisted leader. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll see him out there and he will be laser-focused about business.‚ÄùFriendship Festival is an annual event where Yokota Air Base opens to the general public, offering static displays of numerous aircraft, live performances and a multitude of U.S.-Japan military readiness. Each year welcomes over a hundred thousand people to the airfield.While off duty, Hara had spent his free time volunteering on multiple occasions through organizing a sports day for two local elementary schools, leading 105 parent volunteers, planning 12 events, and even procuring $1,400 for prizes.‚ÄúHis years of experience, continuity and dedication to volunteering his free time contributed to his nomination for this award," said Collins. ‚ÄúAnytime you see him mentioned on social media there are comments about how many Airmen's lives he‚Äôs influenced and the respect he‚Äôs earned.‚ÄùTo Hara, while even the civilian guard job can be difficult, his leadership has always supported his team and he attributes their support as a driving factor for his success and award nomination.The Air Force Outstanding Security Forces Flight-level Civilian Supervisor of the Year award serves as a testament of Hara‚Äôs contributions as a Japanese civilian partner, whose expertise and dedication play a vital role in achieving the 374th Airlift Wing‚Äôs shared objectives to ensure the security of a free and open Indo-Pacific region.

organizations.name: airlift wing public affairs yokota air base

author: Base
title: Hundreds Exchange Nutrient Management, Equipment & Soil Health Strategies at 2025 National Strip-Tillage Conference | Farms.com
text:
Nearly 400 farmers, agronomists, researchers, educators, dealers and manufacturers from all over the U.S. and other countries including Canada and Ireland, packed the Hyatt Regency in Coralville, Iowa for the 12th annual National Strip-Tillage Conference July 31-Aug. 1.
Jerry Hatfield, the former director of the USDA Laboratory for Agriculture and the Environment, kicked off the action with a keynote presentation ‚Äî sponsored by Youngblut Ag ‚Äî about strip-till‚Äôs critical role in the quest for healthier soils.Elk Point, S.D., strip-tiller Joey Hanson was up next with a ‚Äúmeat and potatoes‚Äù 12th Anniversary Lecture ‚Äî sponsored by Conservation Ag Foundation ‚Äî about his top observations from over 100,000 acres of custom strip-tilling in South Dakota, Nebraska and Iowa.

author: Staff Writer
title: Lighting up the future
text:
The Atlas Copco CEA HiLight BI+ 4 hybrid light tower has landed in Australia, and is ideal for local mine sites, where it can light the way to a brighter future.
A tlas CEA, the distributor of Atlas Copco lighting towers in Australia, has expanded its established range of HiLight temporary lighting solutions with the addition of the BI+ 4.
The new HiLight BI+ 4 Hybrid Light Tower builds on the existing range to incorporate lithium-ion batteries and a low-consumption Stage V diesel engine.
The result is a hybrid-power lighting solution that offers a reliable source of light that doesn‚Äôt cost the Earth.
‚ÄúAtlas Copco has a focus on developing a variety of products across their power portfolio for a more sustainable future,‚Äù Atlas CEA Atlas Copco brand leader David Buttigieg told Australian Mining .
‚ÄúThe BI4 was born through a series of battery development projects and an addition to the already proven lighting tower range adding battery technology.‚Äù
The tower features four operating modes ‚Äì it can be powered directly from mains electricity, from its lithium-ion batteries, from its diesel engine, or from a hybrid setting to make the most of the energy available.
The new hybrid light towers offer battery autonomy of up to six hours when operating at full capacity. And, when using their dimming function, they can provide over 19 hours of silent and emission-free operation with a single charge.
With a battery recharging time of just four hours, the HiLight BI+ 4 can also feature an external power plug as an added option.
Buttigieg said operators can be assured of the robustness and quality of the HiLight BI+ 4.
‚ÄúAtlas Copco products have long been known for their strength and build quality,‚Äù Buttigieg said.
‚ÄúThe site conditions across Australia can be diverse and demanding. It‚Äôs critical our products can withstand these conditions to support our local customer needs.
‚ÄúIts what you would expect from Atlas Copco ‚Äì a proven, efficient, sustainable, reliable and well supported product for now and into the future.‚Äù
The HiLight BI+ 4 requires a service interval every 1500 hours of lighting, saving operators on costs associated with maintenance and servicing. With a 60 per cent reduction in engine runtime, these service intervals are three times longer than light towers that run solely on diesel.
‚ÄúWith the capacity to run for an extensive period, the BI+4 ensures worksites stay well-lit with energy-efficient luminosity, night after night,‚Äù Buttigieg said.
Not only is the HiLight built to last, but each tower also has four floodlights providing 150-watt power to reliably cover 4000 square metres at 20 lux.
The HiLight BI+ 4 employs surface-mount device LED technology, which Buttigieg said is renowned for its energy efficiency and reliability, and which extends the working day and contributes to a safer working environment.
‚ÄúWith the ability to light such a large area, the HiLight range is both efficient and practical,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWith safety a high priority for us and our customer base, we are confident the range ensures sites are safe without limiting the opportunity to be as productive as possible.‚Äù
While keeping visibility at an optimal level on a mine site is essential, it‚Äôs the HiLight BI+ 4‚Äôs potential environmental benefits where the tower really shines.
Thanks to its lithium-ion batteries, the light tower reduces reliance on the diesel engine, cutting CO2 emissions by up to seven tonnes per unit per year compared to traditional diesel-powered light towers.
‚ÄúAtlas Copco has placed a great deal of focus on creating a range that is efficient and environmentally conscious and delivers a cost-effective solution for its customers,‚Äù Buttigieg said.
The HiLight BI+ 4 is a versatile lighting solution suited for various applications, including construction sites, events, mining operations, emergency situations and rental services. Its ability to operate on batteries, diesel and hybrid mode provides users with flexibility, catering to diverse operational needs while enhancing sustainability and reducing operational costs.
‚ÄúThe interest for the BI4 has been really positive and now we have product to demonstrate supporting those opportunities,‚Äù Buttigieg said.
‚ÄúThe landscape is always evolving and Atlas Copco is at the forefront.‚Äù
This feature appeared in the October 2024 issue of Australian Mining .
